contextId.information: "All who lived around Zechariah and Elizabeth were afraid." It may be helpful to state clearly why they were shocked. AT: "Everyone who lived around them were in awe of God who had done this to Zechariah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Fear came on all who lived around them

contextId.information: It is clear that the reason they could not enter was that the crowd was so large that there was no room for them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "need a physician" are understood from the phrase before this. AT: "only those who are sick need one" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This does not mean they were to only love their enemies and not their friends. This can be stated. AT: "Love your enemies, not only your friends!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to state what the attacker will do to the person. AT: "turn your face so that he can strike the other cheek also" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to restate the healing. AT: "he healed them from evil spirits" or "he set people free from evil spirits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This means a hundred times more than the seeds that were sown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

It is clear from the context that Jesus is talking about understanding and believing. This can be stated clearly and changed to active form. AT: "whoever has understanding will be given more understanding" or "God will enable those who believe the truth to understand even more"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to the one who has, more will be given to him

contextId.information: It is clear from the context that Jesus is talking about understanding and believing. This can be stated clearly and changed to active form. AT: "But whoever does not have understanding will lose even what understanding he thinks he has" or "But God will cause those who do not believe the truth not to understand even the little that they think they have understood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the one who does not have ... will be taken away from him

contextId.information: "that she could not keep secret what she had done." It may be helpful to state what she did. AT: "that she could not keep it a secret that she was the one who had touched Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: that she could not escape notice

contextId.information: It may be helpful to restate part of the question here. AT: "Some say you are John the Baptist" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

"I have given you authority to crush the power of the enemy" or "I have given you authority to defeat the enemy." The enemy is Satan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: over all the power of the enemy

contextId.information: It might be helpful to give more information. AT: "In the same way, you should also go and help everyone you can" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add extra information. AT: "Jesus was driving a demon out of a person" or "Jesus was making a demon leave a person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Jesus was driving out a demon

contextId.information: It may be helpful to add extra information. AT: "when the demon had gone out of the man" or "when the demon left the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: When the demon had gone out

contextId.information: It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "but they place it on a lampstand" or " but they put it on a table" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to state what they receive. AT: "give to poor people the money you earn from the sales" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to state that this refers to people. AT: "there will be five people in one house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: there will be five in one house

contextId.information: It may be helpful to give more information. AT: "If he does not first count the cost" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

They did not repeat many of the details to keep the story short. AT: "the second married her and the same thing happened" or "the second brother married her and died without having any children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

They did not repeat many of the details to keep the story short. AT: "in the same way the rest of the seven brothers married her and had no children and died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: likewise the seven also left no children, and died

contextId.information: It may be helpful to some audiences to include more about the conversation. AT: "We did not lack anything" or "We had everything we needed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to repeat the reference to time. AT: "and the time of the authority of darkness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"tell us that you are the Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

It may be helpful to add information that is not included in the short statement. AT: "Even Herod does not think he is guilty" (UDB) or "Even Herod thinks he is innocent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Words are left out to keep the phrase short. AT: "they will say to the hills" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
